evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: First: Plaintiffs challenge the constitutionality of Executive Order 14193 (February 1, 2025 (Imposing Duties to Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border)1, as amended by Section 3 of Executive Order 14197 (Progress on our Northern Border)2 and further amended by Executive Order 142313 of March 6, 2025 (Amendment to Duties To Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border)).

extracted.value: Challenge to the constitutionality of Executive Order 14193 (February 1, 2025 (Imposing Duties to Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border)1, as amended by Section 3 of Executive Order 14197 (Progress on our Northern Border)2 and further amended by Executive Order 142313 of March 6, 2025 (Amendment to Duties To Address the Flow of Illicit Drugs Across Our Northern Border)).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Second: Plaintiffs challenge Proclamation 10896 (steel) and Proclamation 10895 (aluminum).

extracted.value: Challenge to the constitutionality of Proclamations 10896 (steel) and 10895 (aluminum).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Third: Plaintiffs challenge the constitutionality of the Executive Order issued April 2, 2025 (Regulating Imports with a Reciprocal Tariff to Rectify Trade Practices that Contribute to Large and Persistent Annual United States Goods Trade Deficits).

extracted.value: Challenge to the constitutionality of the Executive Order issued April 2, 2025 (Regulating Imports with a Reciprocal Tariff to Rectify Trade Practices that Contribute to Large and Persistent Annual United States Goods Trade Deficits).

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs ask the Court to enjoin Sections 2(a), (b), (d), (f), (g), (h) of Executive Order 14193 as amended; Section 14 of Proclamations 10896 and 10895; and Sections 2, 3(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), Section 4(a), (b), (c), (d) of Executive Order April 2, 2025.

extracted.value: Declaratory judgment to enjoin Sections 2(a), (b), (d), (f), (g), (h) of Executive Order 14193 as amended; Section 14 of Proclamations 10896 and 10895; and Sections 2, 3(a), (b), (c), (d), (e), (f), Section 4(a), (b), (c), (d) of Executive Order April 2, 2025.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: Plaintiffs ask the Court to enjoin the Canada Orders.

evidence.source_document: Complaint for Declaratory and Injunctive Relief
evidence.text: stay all tariffs under the Canada Orders on all commerce and goods at the Roosville, Del Bonita, and Piegan/Carway ports of entry that are the historical ports of entry for the Kootenai and Blackfeet Tribes.
